examples.text: Oraya salı vardık, ertesi gün de onu gördük.
examples.translation: We arrived there Tuesday and we saw him the following day.
The show has been delayed tomorrow compulsorily.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish ایرته (irte, erte, “tomorrow”), from Proto-Turkic *ẹ̄rte (“morning”), a derivation from Proto-Turkic *ẹ̄r (“early”). Compare Turkmen ertir (“morning, tomorrow”), Uyghur ئەتە (ete, “tomorrow”), Uyghur ئەتىگەن (etigen, “morning”), Uzbek erta (“morning”), Uzbek ertaga (“tomorrow”), Kazakh ертең (erteñ, “tomorrow”), Kazakh ерте (erte, “morning”), Kyrgyz эртең (erteŋ, “morning, tomorrow”), Tatar иртә (irtä, “morning”), Tatar иртәгә (irtägä, “tomorrow”), etc.
